intro: Aeollanthus floribundus, commonly known as the showy flax, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are usually pink or red. Aeollanthus floribundus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
